headline: Simple Beef-Flavored Gravy
description: The best gravy recipe that comes together in no time. Made quick and easy with beef bouillon, flour, onion, and butter. Perfect for any meal.
name: Simple Beef-Flavored Gravy

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour to combine and add onion. Pour in water and season with bouillon.
Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook until thickened.

review.reviewBody: Used recipe for a rough guide as I only needed a small batch. I added a little rosemary, thyme, substituted onion powder for the onion, a little garlic powder, and fresh ground pepper for extra flavor. I used beef flavored “Better than Bullion” to make beef gravy. Served it over some freshly mashed baby golden potatoes with skins on. Very smooth creamy beefy gravy really paired well with the freshly mashed potatoes. I would definitely use and recommend this gravy recipe again.

The ingredients for this gravy are good. But the instructions need a little work. Most know that you don't just dump it all in a pot and expect good gravy. Make the roux with melted butter and flour. Cook for a few minutes then add the broth. I sub 1/2t. onion powder for the cooked onion then when it's the right thickness I add a splash of Worcestershire Sauce. I really brightens the flavor. I make this all the time and always use Better than Bouillon beef base.

If you think it’s too salty, try using better bouillon like Better Than Broth. Cubes or granulated will have a bad effect on gravies. Do sauté the onions in half the butter, make a roux then add other ingredients

This was super easy and quick, I will be making this every time I need a quick gravy. I used chicken bullion so it worked really well as a white gravy for biscuits. I also used dried onion, so it was even easier. The liquid reconstituted the onion so it worked really well.
Fantastic, easy gravy!
It turned out a little salty ! but other than that it taste good and I added some fresh ground pepper !
So easy however tasted great.
This is soooo good. Adding to favorites!

I've made this several times over the past several years. It is so easy and yields great flavor. I recently have begun adding a bit more water to make it a little bit more fluid. I've subbed in beef or chicken bouillon and both work well. If you don't have 'grandma's recipe', or have an inherent skill on gravy making, this is a piece of cake.

I sautéed the onions in the butter first then added the flour and cooked for a minute or so to make a rue. Then I add the beef broth and cook to thicken. DON’T ADD SALT AS THE BEEF BROTH IS SALTY. Add pepper and stir. Best tasting and easiest gravy ever!!

I sautéed the onions in the butter first then added the flour and cooked for a minute or so to make a rue. Then I add the beef broth and cook to thicken. DON’T ADD SALT AS THE BEEF BROTH IS SALTY. Add pepper and stir. Best tasting and easiest gravy ever!!
Was more of a raw onion than beef. Would cook the onion first and add more beef bulion in the bouillon/flour mixture.

I followed this recipe as there were no instructions on the order of ingredients... so, I experienced very lumpy flour... I decided to try again... But... at this point I had no more onions left... I used 2 cubes of bouillon instead of 3 - I used corn starch instead of flour and I added about 1/2 a can of beer... So, in order... boil 1 cup of water, add 2 cubes of bouillon, bring to boil... add 1/4 cup butter.... take 1/2 cup cold water add 1/4 cup of corn starch, stir till creamy, add this to the boiling bouillon, stir frequently as it thickens, and then add beer while stirring... let the alcohol cook out and Voila... ready to serve
Very easy, very tasty, very quick to make. This is my new gravy go-to!
I used beef broth instead of the water and bouillon turned out great have made it 2 times now will be my go recipe from now on

The easiest gravy I’ve ever made! I usually use pan drippings but I didn’t have any with what I was cooking. I wanted 2 c. So I adjusted slightly (3 bouillon cubes, black pepper, 3/8 c flour, 1/4 onion, just a pat of butter). Was done in no time! Thickened nicely and really wonderful flavor! Thank you! Will use again and again.
Tastes great! I will never buy the packets of powder gravy again.
Amazing and delicious. It also tastes good made with chicken bullion. But I always make it without onion.

Simple, quick and easy to adapt. I used this to make the gravy for my smothered pork chops as I didn’t have buttermilk on hand for the recipe. Worked perfectly and is much easier with ingredients that I keep on my shelf.
If you use broth or stock instead of bouillon, it brings down the salt considerably
Quick and easy and very good

I used about 1l of water 1 ounce of beef boullion cubes ~3.5 ounces of flour 3 onions 1 garlic 1 teaspoon of ground pepper some paprika,chilly and mayoran and a cup of butter I also made a roux before adding everything except butter and flour so the gravy was a bit on the thick side.. made some really great gravy and ate it over mashed potatoes steamed rice,mushrooms and carrots
A very good gravy. You have to saute the onions first and then brown the flour, other then that, great recipe
Fabulous! I also created a roux before adding the beef broth. The family loved it!

I had made beef tri tip (with chopped yellow onion and two beef bouillon cubes from knor) in the small crock pot I have so I used 1 1/4 cup of the juices.

I made the roux first with salted butter, added the beef tri tip juices and an additional 1/2 cup of water to get it thinner to my personal liking. Great base recipe to build off of.
Super easy but like others make sure you do things in order...saute onion with 1/2 butter first then add and rest of butter, flour and cook for just a bit.
Favorite simple gravy recipe!

I must say I was really impressed with the results and taste. I looked at the reviews and followed the tips everybody else gave. Make the roux first. Butter and flour once you get the color you want then add the onions. Once the onions are done add the beef bullion cubes. Add your water and keep stirring until it thickens. Great simple recipe.
This was so quick and really tasty.
This recipe was so good, AND easy. I made mine with chicken bouillon paste. I can't wait to try it with beef bouillon paste.

I used it to make beef stroganoff and it turned out great. I always use left over roast beef or steak with mushrooms and chip dip. This time I had no gravy base so I used the exact recipe. My family loved it.
Very good..

Very quick and easy, but also VERY salty (because in part of the additional bullion I used AND I had no unsalted butter). 
No surprise, I wanted the gravy a bit darker so I used 4 bullion cubes, instead of 3. 
I prepared it this way simply because I did not have any gravy, no stock, and no large cuts of meat in the house to make my own pan gravy. 

While whipping up Salisbury steak as a quick, last minute supper, I went to the old standard quickie gravy (here), and it served it's purpose. It did make a thick, flavorful beef gravy.

Typically if I go this route, I use unsalted or low-salt beef stock instead of bullion. 
I also pre-cook the finely diced onion until carmelized, for added flavor. 
Then, just before the onion is finished, I add a small amount (1/2 tsp.) of freshly minced garlic to the onion and cook for 2 minutes. I then whisk it all together, with a few grinds of black pepper, until thickened.
Just as the recipe states, Simple Beef gravy, read the reviews and be sure to add your butter and flour first to make the rue and pour your bullion in last and stir while slowly pouring.
Turned out pretty good! I first made a roux with the butter and flour, and just used dry seasonings to flavour it. It looked more like a chicken gravy, but it tasted quite yummy!
It tastes a little better than the stuff out of the envelopes. You could add mushrooms, green peppers and use it for smothered burgers.
Came out great!!!
The gravy was amazing I added a lot more water because it was so thick but after doing so it was the best I used it for stuffing and baked chicken.
For quick and easy with no pan drippings it turned out great
Tasted great

I loved this recipe, although I did have to substitute the beef bouillon for chicken because that is what I had on hand but it came out delicious. Even my husband whom does not like gravy loved how it came out.

Pretty good, certainly easy, and reliable, if you don't follow the instructions with the recipe. Do as others say - cook the onions in the butter until starting to brown, add the flour, stir well, letting the flour cook a little, then add the liquid very gradually, whisking until all the liquid is incorporated. Bring to a boil and cook until thickened. I'll add less onion next time - it was a little too onion-y for me. We served it on meat loaf to 40 people today and the plates came back clean
Great recipe! Ive decided that this will be my no failure turkey gravy recipe also. Just add the turkey drippings instead of the beef bouillon. Substitute chicken bouillon for chicken dishes.
My dad loves this gravy and he is very picky.

Turned out great. I threw the onions, flour and butter into the pan all at the same time, and cooked the roux until it was a golden brown. I used beef broth rather than bullion, but kept the wet/dry proportional. The only thing I did a bit differently was to use a couple (or three) tablespoons of consommé (Campbell’s) in the gravy for flavor. It already has seasonings in it, and is my secret ingredient when you don’t have all the other stuff you need to dump in beefy-flavored things. I used it on hot brown sandwiches.
SUPER salty. Even when I cut the boullion, it was too salty.

I used organic better than bouillon beef base and onion powder instead of onion so my kids would eat it. Great taste and really just the easiest gravy I have made. I used it for moco loco and everyone loved it. Does not happen often in my house.
The instructions are seriously lacking if someone did not know basic sauce/gravy procedures already.

Horrible! Extremely salty & I like salt! I used 3 t "Better than Bouillon" beef base, maybe that was the problem. Tried to add more flour and water but still toot salty. 

 Putting that aside, way too much onions, I think this would be better if it gave a measured quantity instead of 1 onion. 

 I usually read review before trying a new recipe, I'll have to see how others reviewed this. Sorry.
This is quick fix when you need a sauce....had a good flavor...but it did tighten up on me. I added a little milk and it gave a creaminess to it.....Thanks Happy Cooking!

I am usually helpless when it comes to making gravy. This was a very simple recipe that came out with no lumps. I also browned the flour in the melted butter and slowly added the liquid. I also added salt and pepper to taste. I will most certainly make it again. I give it a 4+.
This was delicious! I used unsalted butter, because that's what I had in the fridge. I didn't find it too salty :)
It was very tasty and a great addition to our leg of lamb. Even my kids (who won't eat gravy) loved it!
My family is not use to salt (in base) so I had to double the recipe... Added more flour and corn starch to a bowl with hot water before adding to already hot gravy mix.

Made it to the exact specifications and it was way too salty, thick and gelatin like. I even tried adding water and nothing helped. My boyfriend usually eats anything and he wouldn't even touch it. Do not recommend.

Wow, didn't think something so simple could taste so good. I was impressed. I combined all ingredients (I used 3 teaspoons of onion granules in place of the onion) except the flour....i brought them to almost a simmer on low heat and then whisked the flour in slowly, instant thicken. It was very tasty and thick. Loved it

I made this exactly as the recipe. So simple and easy and it really was great ! This reminded my wife and myself of the gravy you buy at the store in the jars. After searching for a good simple gravy for a good wile i found a keeper !! thank you so much for this !!
Easy, followed reviews advice on sauté onions, make roux, then add water. Cut recipe in half for 1 adult and two kids. Kids loved it over leftover steak and rice. This is a keeper!

Easy and good! I followed instructions from the reviews on the order of how to make it, and added a little bit of milk at the end because it was thicker than I wanted, but I was really surprised at the taste. I was expecting to add some more flavoring, but this recipe does not need it!
Thank you for the quick and easy recipe. Turned out great!
Very tasty. Took me a few times to master though. I had bullion cubes so I used hot water and when I put the flour in little balls of dough in my gravy. Second time is the charm.
I was looking for a easy gravy recipe and i found this .I have never really made gravy so I followed directions of others. The Onion and butter first. This is a keeper .
Super easy and delicious!

I sauteed the onions in olive oil for a few minutes, then added the butter, then the flour before adding the water and beef bouillion. I like have a roux made before the beef flavor is added. It worked out well and I will definitely be making this again!

Yes my husband and big sons love it that much.
I was in a big hurry so I used 1/2 t. of onion salt
instead of fresh onion.
I also started by making a roue of the butter and flour so
that I was sure not to have any lumps.
I won't be buying brown gravy packets anymore.
This is too easy.
I grew up passing on gravy, but I've grown into it. I made this, and couldn't believe how FABULOUS it was! I wanted to drink it!! I followed the directions and was thrilled with the results.
I was surprised at the good taste of this quick gravy. I tripled the recipe but only needed the 1/4 c. flour to reach the thickness desired. I would definitely use these recipe again.
Great recipe. As suggest d by others, I made a roux and then added the water/bullion, I also added a little Worcestershire sauce for color and taste.

I made this but used 1/4 cup prime rib drippings and 1 tbl of butter as the fat base. It was hella thick, so I ended up using about 2 cups of water. I also substituted thyme, garlic, onion, salt at 1/2 tsp each instead of bouillon.

Good gravy, just make sure you melt the butter and sautee the flour before adding other ingredients. Also I used cubed bullion instead of powder. I put 3 chicken cubes and 3 beef cubes and added 1/3 c. Milk to cut down on the saltiness. It was quite salty but after I added the milk it was perfect! Thank you :)

Oh, good gravy! (Wink.) So delicious for something so simple! I didn't have onions, so I threw in (for a double batch) just under a teaspoon of onion powder and a couple dashes of garlic powder.
YUM!
Awesome, quick & easy gravy! Everyone loved it!
Very simple gravy recipe to follow and make I just left out the onions and I make it for our beef tips and noodles dinners

awesome gravy. my husband ate the whole thing. I made it just for him because no one in the household eats gravy and he loved it!!! Used the exact ingredients but cooked the onions and butter first then added the rest. will make again for Thanksgiving.
This was simple, fast, and tasted great. I'll be making this again.
This came out perfect. I followed the directions exactly, added a little garlic powder and pepper and it tasted great over noodles and meatballs.

This recipe is simple and delicious :) But way too salty, I suggest to reduce the butter by 5 grams or just add more water until it's not that salty anymore. I do exactly as advised in the comment section to avoid lumps and the result is wonderful. And most importantly because this recipe is very easy to make, I'll be sure to use this recipe again in the future :D
With the help of how to make roux and added worchestershire, it's perfect! Just be careful of salt.

Very easy ..dump everything in the pan and stir..I did not include onions

Made it for my Loco Moco ?

Delicious! And saved me a trip to the store just for gravy! Very easy to make. I followed other reviewers advice and sauteed the onion in half the butter first then did butter and flour to make a roux whisking continually. First time I've made decent gravy from scratch!
Used beef juice from crock pot with the flour was great and so easy.

This was great, I used a couple of different suggestions. I sautéed the onions in the butter, then added flour and cooked that for a bit, added beef bouillon(powder), added a small amount of Worcestershire sauce and water. Stirred with a whisk often.
Perfect. I didn't use onions. I made a roux with the butter and flour then added the beef broth. Wonderful with meatloaf and mashed potatoes.
Just what I was hoping it would be!

Total newbie but trying to make some changes to my family's food from packaged to homemade. So I used organic flour and natural beef broth in place of the water. I added black pepper and did as others by sauteing the onions first, added flour then the beef broth. I did add a tsp of beef bouillon trying to darken the light gravy but it did not help. It tastes like roasted gravy but sort of looks like chicken gravy. For a first time try it was simple, delicious and all natural ingredients. I am so glad I tried this.
Silly me. I sauté the onion and prepare a roux. Delicious with dimension! Love this simple recipe! Thank you!
Simple recipe using staples. Perfect for when the complementary meat is being grilled and drippings are unavailable.
The recipe was so easy and tasted great! I added everything at once and the onions were tender. I mixed it with browned ground beef and put over mashed potatoes..... Yummy!
So simple!
I ADDED TOO MUCH FLOUR WHOOPS

Used the "bones" of this recipe this evening. I am not a fan of bullion and used beef broth instead. Sauteed the onions in the butter, added beef broth to the flour and mixed very well. Put broth in with the sauteed onions, added the flour mix and as I was taught by my polish grandmother-in-law..... you MUST boil the gravy for at LEAST a minute to get rid of the flour taste. Then I added some gravy master for added color. VERY very good on the fly gravy. This will be my mainstay recipe for when I dont have drippings to make real gravy. I prefer the broth over the bullion so I can control the salt.
The onions cooked slowly due to cooking it in the wrong order making it stick to the bottom of the pan. See the suggestions of others here.

Oh my gosh this is so good. I used better than bouillon beef base, about two spoonfuls. I reduced the amount of water to about 1 cup. It made a pretty thick delicious gravy. I will be using this from now on. My pattern of cooking this recipe was melting the butter and mixing in the beef base, mixing the flour and water separately and then slowly adding it into the mixture of butter and base.
Simple is good,people! My only tweak next time would include sauteeing the minced onion first in half the allotted butter than adding the remaining butter when adding in the other ingredients.
Pretty tasty. I think I will use only half the onions next time. Went well with egg noodles and Italian meatballs for a quick meal.
Didn't bother with a roux and omitted the butter all together. Seasoned mine with white pepper, black pepper, and worcestershire.
This was very tasty.
I made Jane Crowly's version since I didn't have a onion. I added canned mushrooms and it was yummy!
this is really great way to make a simple gravy! Awesome!!!!!!
